events.description: The European Central Bank's meeting to decide on interest rates.
Germany's plan to raise a record amount of debt for infrastructure and defense.

evidences.evidence_text: Germany’s 10-year Bund yield was little changed at 2.87%

facts.fact_text: Germany plans to raise a record €512 billion this year.

evidences.evidence_text: Germany plans to raise a record €512 billion this year to finance infrastructure upgrades and increased defense spending.

facts.fact_text: Eurozone headline CPI eased to 1.7% in January.

evidences.evidence_text: Recent data showed eurozone inflation cooled sharply in January, with headline CPI easing to 1.7%

facts.fact_text: Core inflation in the eurozone fell to 2.2%.

evidences.evidence_text: core inflation unexpectedly falling to 2.2%, its lowest level since October 2021.

claims.claim_text: The ECB is expected to leave interest rates unchanged.
claims.author: Market consensus

evidences.evidence_text: The ECB is widely expected to leave interest rates unchanged for a fifth straight meeting

claims.claim_text: Christine Lagarde will reiterate that policy remains in a good place.
claims.author: Market analysts

evidences.evidence_text: ECB President Christine Lagarde is expected to reiterate that policy remains in a “good place,”

claims.claim_text: Markets are pricing in steady interest rates through 2026.
claims.author: Markets

evidences.evidence_text: with markets pricing in steady rates through 2026.
